title: How to Decorate Donuts

steps.headline: Whisk all of your ingredients, minus the donut, into your saucepan.
steps.description: The kind of food coloring is your choice. Mix everything together until it is consistent with no clumps. If you're having trouble with consistency, you can sift your sugar through a sieve before adding it to the mix.

steps.headline: Prepare your work area.
steps.description: Set down your mixing bowl beside your donuts and set up a draining rack in a half sheet pan. Make sure that all of your ingredients and tools are easily accessible. Prepare some napkins in case things get messy.

steps.headline: Dip your donuts into the glaze.
steps.description: Either dip them one by one or spoon the glaze over them using a small measuring spoon. Allow the excess glaze to drip over the sides. Afterwards, set them on a draining rack placed in a half sheet pan. For dipping, hold each donut with three fingers and your thumb. Dip it about halfway down, keeping even around the edges as much as possible. While the donut is upside down, shake off any excess glaze. Customize your glazes. If you want to change things up, divide your glaze into any number of separate bowls. Afterwards, you can add different food colorings to each. Apply sprinkles. If you're not using mixed sprinkles, dump various colors into your ice cube tray and mix them up. This is a simple and effective way of organizing your materials. It also allows you to mix and match your favorite sprinkle colors.

methods.name: Creating Peanut Butter and Jelly Donuts

steps.headline: Whisk all of your ingredients together.
steps.description: Put all of the ingredients, minus the donuts and chips, into a mixing bowl. Whisk them together until they have a smooth consistency. Your choice of donut base is up to you. If you choose to use plain donuts, move on to the next step. If you're going to make jelly-filled donuts, skip the addition of raspberry or strawberry jam in your glaze.

steps.headline: Setup your workstation.
steps.description: Make sure that all of your ingredients are within arms reach. Again, place a draining rack into a half sheet pan. Keep napkins handy in case things get messy.

steps.headline: Pour the glaze onto your donuts.
steps.description: Use a measuring spoon to gently pour the glaze over each one. You can sift the sugar through a sieve before adding it to the mix for a better consistency. Use a knife to smooth it out like you would spread peanut butter onto a sandwich.

steps.headline: Sprinkle your peanut butter baking chips onto the donut.
steps.description: If you're not too hot on this decoration, you can substitute it as you please. For example, you can sprinkle chopped peanuts, Reese bites, or other peanut butter-flavoured products.

steps.headline: Clean your strawberries.
steps.description: Start off by washing them under clean running water. Keep moving them gently to ensure that they are properly cleaned. Remove the green tops from each one. If a little bit is left behind, don't worry too much. Afterwards, let them dry in a small bowl.

steps.headline: Whip your heavy cream.
steps.description: Add the heavy cream into your electric mixer with the whisk attached. Set it to medium speed and whisk it for 2 to 4 minutes. Afterwards, add in your vanilla extract and confectioners' sugar. Continue whipping on medium speed for around 2 to 3 minutes or until the soft peaks return.

steps.headline: Cut each of your strawberries in half.
steps.description: Afterwards, use a kitchen knife to cut them into smaller pieces. Once you have the size that you want, place them back into the small bowl.

steps.headline: Spoon your sweetened whipped cream onto the donut.
steps.description: Use a measuring spoon to portion out about 4 scoops onto your donut. Afterwards use the back of it to apply it over the donut. This will provide a proper foundation for your decorations. .

steps.headline: Apply basil leaves or fresh flowers.
steps.description: Basil leaves are a great way to top off this donut. For something more fancy, you can use flowers. During the spring and summer, you'll have plenty of of options to pluck for your donut decorations. If you use flowers, make sure that they are organic and unsprayed (select supermarkets carry them in the produce area). You can also grow your own in your backyard.

text: Making Birthday Cake Donuts Whisk all of your ingredients, minus the donut, into your saucepan. The kind of food coloring is your choice. Mix everything together until it is consistent with no clumps. If you're having trouble with consistency, you can sift your sugar through a sieve before adding it to the mix. Prepare your work area. Set down your mixing bowl beside your donuts and set up a draining rack in a half sheet pan. Make sure that all of your ingredients and tools are easily accessible. Prepare some napkins in case things get messy. Dip your donuts into the glaze. Either dip them one by one or spoon the glaze over them using a small measuring spoon. Allow the excess glaze to drip over the sides. Afterwards, set them on a draining rack placed in a half sheet pan. For dipping, hold each donut with three fingers and your thumb. Dip it about halfway down, keeping even around the edges as much as possible. While the donut is upside down, shake off any excess glaze. Customize your glazes. If you want to change things up, divide your glaze into any number of separate bowls. Afterwards, you can add different food colorings to each. Apply sprinkles. If you're not using mixed sprinkles, dump various colors into your ice cube tray and mix them up. This is a simple and effective way of organizing your materials. It also allows you to mix and match your favorite sprinkle colors. Creating Peanut Butter and Jelly Donuts Whisk all of your ingredients together. Put all of the ingredients, minus the donuts and chips, into a mixing bowl. Whisk them together until they have a smooth consistency. Your choice of donut base is up to you. If you choose to use plain donuts, move on to the next step. If you're going to make jelly-filled donuts, skip the addition of raspberry or strawberry jam in your glaze. Setup your workstation. Make sure that all of your ingredients are within arms reach. Again, place a draining rack into a half sheet pan. Keep napkins handy in case things get messy. Pour the glaze onto your donuts. Use a measuring spoon to gently pour the glaze over each one. You can sift the sugar through a sieve before adding it to the mix for a better consistency. Use a knife to smooth it out like you would spread peanut butter onto a sandwich. Sprinkle your peanut butter baking chips onto the donut. If you're not too hot on this decoration, you can substitute it as you please. For example, you can sprinkle chopped peanuts, Reese bites, or other peanut butter-flavoured products. Making Strawberry Shortcake Donuts Clean your strawberries. Start off by washing them under clean running water. Keep moving them gently to ensure that they are properly cleaned. Remove the green tops from each one. If a little bit is left behind, don't worry too much. Afterwards, let them dry in a small bowl. Whip your heavy cream. Add the heavy cream into your electric mixer with the whisk attached. Set it to medium speed and whisk it for 2 to 4 minutes. Afterwards, add in your vanilla extract and confectioners' sugar. Continue whipping on medium speed for around 2 to 3 minutes or until the soft peaks return. Cut each of your strawberries in half. Afterwards, use a kitchen knife to cut them into smaller pieces. Once you have the size that you want, place them back into the small bowl. Spoon your sweetened whipped cream onto the donut. Use a measuring spoon to portion out about 4 scoops onto your donut. Afterwards use the back of it to apply it over the donut. This will provide a proper foundation for your decorations. . Apply basil leaves or fresh flowers. Basil leaves are a great way to top off this donut. For something more fancy, you can use flowers. During the spring and summer, you'll have plenty of of options to pluck for your donut decorations. If you use flowers, make sure that they are organic and unsprayed (select supermarkets carry them in the produce area). You can also grow your own in your backyard. Finished.

The kind of food coloring is your choice.
Mix everything together until it is consistent with no clumps.
If you're having trouble with consistency, you can sift your sugar through a sieve before adding it to the mix.
Prepare your work area.
Set down your mixing bowl beside your donuts and set up a draining rack in a half sheet pan.
Make sure that all of your ingredients and tools are easily accessible.
Prepare some napkins in case things get messy.
Dip your donuts into the glaze.
Either dip them one by one or spoon the glaze over them using a small measuring spoon.
Allow the excess glaze to drip over the sides.
Afterwards, set them on a draining rack placed in a half sheet pan.
For dipping, hold each donut with three fingers and your thumb.
Dip it about halfway down, keeping even around the edges as much as possible.
While the donut is upside down, shake off any excess glaze.
Customize your glazes.
If you want to change things up, divide your glaze into any number of separate bowls.
Afterwards, you can add different food colorings to each.

If you're not using mixed sprinkles, dump various colors into your ice cube tray and mix them up.
This is a simple and effective way of organizing your materials.
It also allows you to mix and match your favorite sprinkle colors.
Creating Peanut Butter and Jelly Donuts Whisk all of your ingredients together.
Put all of the ingredients, minus the donuts and chips, into a mixing bowl.
Whisk them together until they have a smooth consistency.
Your choice of donut base is up to you.
If you choose to use plain donuts, move on to the next step.
If you're going to make jelly-filled donuts, skip the addition of raspberry or strawberry jam in your glaze.
Setup your workstation.
Make sure that all of your ingredients are within arms reach.
Again, place a draining rack into a half sheet pan.
Keep napkins handy in case things get messy.
Pour the glaze onto your donuts.
Use a measuring spoon to gently pour the glaze over each one.
You can sift the sugar through a sieve before adding it to the mix for a better consistency.
Use a knife to smooth it out like you would spread peanut butter onto a sandwich.
Sprinkle your peanut butter baking chips onto the donut.
If you're not too hot on this decoration, you can substitute it as you please.
For example, you can sprinkle chopped peanuts, Reese bites, or other peanut butter-flavoured products.
Making Strawberry Shortcake Donuts Clean your strawberries.
Start off by washing them under clean running water.
Keep moving them gently to ensure that they are properly cleaned.
Remove the green tops from each one.
If a little bit is left behind, don't worry too much.
Afterwards, let them dry in a small bowl.
Whip your heavy cream.
Add the heavy cream into your electric mixer with the whisk attached.
Set it to medium speed and whisk it for 2 to 4 minutes.
Afterwards, add in your vanilla extract and confectioners' sugar.
Continue whipping on medium speed for around 2 to 3 minutes or until the soft peaks return.
Cut each of your strawberries in half.
Afterwards, use a kitchen knife to cut them into smaller pieces.
Once you have the size that you want, place them back into the small bowl.
Spoon your sweetened whipped cream onto the donut.
Use a measuring spoon to portion out about 4 scoops onto your donut.
Afterwards use the back of it to apply it over the donut.
This will provide a proper foundation for your decorations.
Apply basil leaves or fresh flowers.
Basil leaves are a great way to top off this donut.
For something more fancy, you can use flowers.
During the spring and summer, you'll have plenty of of options to pluck for your donut decorations.
If you use flowers, make sure that they are organic and unsprayed (select supermarkets carry them in the produce area).
You can also grow your own in your backyard.
Finished.
